docs.lead_paragraph: Questions on how teachers should be evaluated have been added to traditional issues of pay, benefits and working conditions as Chicago teachers walk picket lines.

headline.seo: Chicago Is Focus of National Debate on Schools
headline.main: National Schools Debate Is on Display in Chicago
headline.print_headline: National Schools Debate Is on Display in Chicago

docs.abstract: What started in Chicago as a traditional labor fight by teachers over pay, benefits and working conditions has exploded into a dramatic illustration of the national debate over how public school districts should rate teachers; at stake are profound policy questions about how teachers should be granted tenure, promoted or fired, as well as the place standardized tests will have in the lives of elementary and high school students.
docs.snippet: Questions on how teachers should be evaluated have been added to traditional issues of pay, benefits and working conditions as Chicago teachers walk picket lines.

docs.abstract: My husband and I agreed that we would terminate a fetus with genetic defects. We're too old to parent a special-needs child.

docs.lead_paragraph: Has a loss of intestinal bacteria caused our immune systems to go haywire? Moises Velasquez-Manoff lays out the hygiene hypothesis.

headline.seo: ‘An Epidemic of Absence’ Review - Seeing Hygiene as Driver of Disease
headline.main: A Messy, Exuberant Case Against Being Too Clean

docs.lead_paragraph: Modern biology is making it clearer by the day that a man’s health and well-being have a measurable impact on his future children’s health and happiness.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Judith Shulevitz, the science editor for The New Republic, examines the growing body of research on epigenetic inheritance, or ways in which parents, particularly fathers, influence the their children's genetic makeup.
docs.snippet: Modern biology is making it clearer by the day that a man’s health and well-being have a measurable impact on his future children’s health and happiness.

docs.lead_paragraph: It's not quite "Mad Men Missouri," but a little drama is playing out in a dispute between a beleaguered Senate candidate and a television ad department in the state. The candidate is Representative Todd Akin , a Republican who is on the defensive for remarks he made in his campaign against Senator Claire McCaskill, a Democrat. The television station is KOMU-8, an NBC affiliate in Colombia, Mo., that reported that it had pulled Mr. Akin's ads midway through its intended run because of an unpaid bill.

headline.main: Ad Run Canceled: Akin's Finances in Question

docs.abstract: Caucus column; report that a Missouri television station pulled Rep Todd Akin's political advertisements due to an unpaid bill raises questions about whether the embattled candidate has enough cash to go forward with his bid to unseat Sen Claire McCaskill. Photos (M)0
docs.snippet: It's not quite "Mad Men Missouri," but a little drama is playing out in a dispute between a beleaguered Senate candidate and a television ad department in the state.   The candidate is Representative  Todd Akin , a Republican who is on the defensive...
